titles.title: Daniel Webster Congressional Fellowship Act

To establish the Daniel Webster Congressional Fellowship Program for qualified graduates of law schools to serve in temporary positions in offices of the House of Representatives and Senate, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 9/27/2006--Introduced. Daniel Webster Congressional Fellowship Act - Establishes the Daniel Webster Congressional Fellowship Program, under which up to 40 eligible law school graduates shall be selected by specified congressional leaders as Daniel Webster Congressional Fellows for each Congress. Requires a Fellow to serve as an employee in a participating office of the House or Senate during the Congress for which the individual is selected. Specifies eligibility criteria for a Fellow, including a juris doctor degree.
